Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: brewers51
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel. I was very pleased with my stay except for he hole in the bathroom door (looks like it was kicked), and nasty, nasty hair in the bathtub! The bed was comfortable, wonderful pillows. I wasn't able to connect to the free WiFi (not sure why)..Breakfast was small, just OK in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staffs, under remodeling”
Reviews.Author: Carol0143
Reviews.Content: The location of this Quality Inn is good, very close to the mall and restaurants and surrounded by other 2-star hotels. Staffs at the front desk and breakfast area are very nice. The room is spacious. However, the carpet and the walls need remodeling. There are white stains on the carpet, and later the front desk lady told me those could be paint stains from remodeling. I found two things different from the Expedia description. First, the front desk hour ends at midnight, not 24-hour. Second, the breakfast selection is much better than in the picture!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price-worth going out of your way!”
Reviews.Author: Jsgulbrandson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling with our two small children over Christmas when we came unexpectedly upon a need for a hotel. This Quality Inn had the most comfortable beds, a pool for the kids, hot waffle/biscuit and gravy breakfast and the best cheap hotel orange juice I have ever had. The staff was friendly and it fit our needs perfectly. Worth driving out of the way for!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: norshore
Reviews.Content: We had an emergency trip to the U of I Animal Hospital, and they decided to keep the dog overnight, so we needed a place to stay. I usually go with hotels I am familiar with and comfortable with, as well as the free breakfast! In this case I still wanted the free breakfast, but outside of that I was open. I plugged in my GPS and asked for a list of hotels, scrolled through and found "Comfort Inn", which I knew had a free breakfast. When I called, the clerk answered "Quality Inn". My GPS has not been uploaded for new info for a long time. I asked "Do you have something for tonight?", and he said yes. "Do you serve free breakfast?", and he said yes again. So we drove over there. There was very little to complain about. For $80.99 plus tax, we had a double with a box TV and a bath. The beds were comfortable, the TV worked, and the toilet flushed. The room was very clean, and the pool and hot tub, while I didn't use them, were observed to be clean and warm. Breakfast was served from 7:00 to 10:00. They served biscuits and gravy, do-it-yourself waffles, hard boiled eggs, assorted sweetrolls, donuts and English Muffins, dry cereal, juice and coffee. The coffee was great! There was no hot oatmeal, and that was a disappointment, but the serving area was small. The staff seemed friendly and accommodating, and they weren't very busy. In fact I doubt even half of their rooms were taken. The hotel was very quiet, and there was plenty of parking in a small lot on this Friday night. If there was anything to complain about, it was the size of the bathroom. To get to the shower we had to close the door, and closing the door meant a tight squeeze. I was also a little perturbed that the water pressure at the bathroom sink was weak. However design flaws and water saver faucets go back to senior management, not local staff. The carpeting in the dining area was bunched and wrinkled, but staff there said someone had bought the hotel and it was going to be completely rehabbed soon. From my experience, there didn't seem the need to rehab too much.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough”
Reviews.Author: memphismom03
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our way to MI for our family vacation. If I had known there were so many hotels on this path I would have chosen something else, but the price was right. Front Desk was nice, not too sociable(but that is ok). Stayed in a double bed room. Just a room… plain. No fridge, so make sure to ask for a room with a fridge if that is what you want. Pool was just ok, caulk was coming up everywhere and there were no towels. Kids enjoyed it. The best thing about the hotel… the beds. I thought they were very comfortable, and I had my 2 sons in the bed with me;)

Reviews.Title: “Staying with the bugs.”
Reviews.Author: becmac32
Reviews.Content: This was the worse experience ever. We arrived and was checked into our room to find it full of crickets (dead & alive). When we unfolded the couch it was full of dead crickets. When i ask for more towels because we had 6 people in our party they made us feel like we were trying to steel the extra towels. The room was dirty not just from the crickets but it had not been swept in weeks. When we checked out the manager was very rude when i explained we were not happy with the dirt and crickets. Will NOT stay there and would NOT recommend staying.

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable and loved the spa and pool!”
Reviews.Author: Treenzs
Reviews.Content: This was like luxury for us coming in from a long trip. We immediately on arrival made use of the beautiful indoor pool and spa pool - both very clean and so inviting. The room was great - we had free internet. The bed was incredibly comfortable as were the pillows. We slept through the breakfast which was included so missed out on that and were woken before our checkout time by a housekeeper - and when I said yes, she seemed embarrassed she had disturbed us. I'm not sure why the housekeepers have to do that - surely its easy for them to find out which rooms are checked out and which aren't? Overall very relaxing and would definitely stop there again - if we get to I will look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: nmfirepilot
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of hotels, and this was one of the least impressive Choice hotels I have stayed in. First room I checked into had two smushed spiders on the wall, and a live earwig. Wall was quite dirty with need of repainting. Staff did apologize and give me another room, and it was cleaner, but walls still somewhat dingy and needed a repainting too. If you are travelling alone and just looking for something cheaper, its okay I supposed. But if it is with others, I would consider going to the Comfort Suites down the road, which was pricier but much much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: argonauts52
Reviews.Content: Average Hotel near the interstate I-74, 3 miles from U of I campus. Not the best hotel in town, but it was a free night. Renovations are needed, do not expect to be wowed by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what their website said!”
Reviews.Author: Sadrake
Reviews.Content: My daughter was between apartments while attending the University of Illinois, so I needed to put her up for two nights at a local hotel. The Comfort Inn was the wrong choice for us. Their website said "deluxed continental breakfast," but no breakfast could be found at 8:30 a.m. Their website said "free high speed internet access in all rooms," but when my daughter didn't find any, the front desk clerk said there was none. Their website said "Free USA Today," yeah right. The walls were very thin and it was easy to hear the fight between a husband and wife in the next room. Very disappointing. My daughter had to bail out after the first night. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: sarah303030
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a room here and it turns out they gave us a suite (for the same price) so that was a plus. Room was clean, large, and pretty quiet overnight. Turns out the back of the hotel looks out over a very bright volvo car lot that leaves its lights on all night. Thank goodness for blackout curtains, they did the trick! The breakfast in the morning was so-so. Pretty meager offerings and a small eating area, we ended up grabbing a donut and cereal and pouring some milk to eat back in our room. I wish we could have checked out the shopping mall just down the road, but tired kids prevented us from that. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KitKatDunlap
Reviews.Content: Our Dance Team came to Champaign for a competition and Nora the asst. manager was so helpful. She made sure we all were put together and that we in the non smoking area. The rooms were comfortable, clean, warm and beds comfy. The continental breakfast was delicious and the lady was keeping it very clean and helped us make our waffle. Nora even offered to open it up earlier than normal if our dance team needed to eat early before we left for our competition. The location is so close to the mall and lots of restaurants. Our team would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't end up staying”
Reviews.Author: kevrhon
Reviews.Content: I don't know if this is appropriate for this forum or not. I hope it's helpful, and not just the ranting of a disgruntled traveler. I was traveling on business, driving from Chicago to St. Louis. About half way home I stopped to spend the night at the Comfort Inn in Champaign, IL, using Choice Privileges frequent guest points. It looked like a nice facility, as I’ve come to expect from the Choice Hotels brand. When I went in to register, there was no one at the desk. There was a sign indicating that the desk clerk was away helping other guests. I understood this, and waited for him to return. I was tired and admittedly out of sorts, and was a bit sarcastic when the young man returned after about 10-15 minutes. He asked if he could help me, and I asked if he could check me in, “If it’s not too much trouble.” He said, “Why would it be any trouble?” I replied, “I don’t know, but I’ve been waiting for over 10 minutes.” He smirked, and said, “I put out the sign.” I explained that the sign didn’t check me in, and he responded, sarcastically, that he had to wait on other guests. At this point, I asked for my credit card and ID, and said I’d go elsewhere. As I said, I had a bit of an attitude myself, and take half the blame for this exchange, although I've been in a number of hotels where the staff were very courteous to me when I gave them reason not to be. That's no excuse on my part, I know. But this is not why I was so upset by this particular incident. I called Choice Privileges to see if I could cancel the reservation. The guest services representative said she would call the hotel to see if they would allow me to cancel. “Or,” I added, “just apologize for my delay. That’s all I really want." She came back on the line after talking to this young gentleman, and said he’d agreed to cancel the reservation. “He’d rather cancel my reservation, than apologize?” “Yes, apparently so. He sounded rather snooty to me,” the guest services rep admitted. Choice Privileges ultimately took good care of me, and found me a room nearby at another hotel, and compensated me somewhat for my inconvenience. I don’t know when, if ever, I’ll find myself again in Champaign/Urbana, but I know I won’t be staying at the Comfort Inn on Marketview.

HotelInfo.Name: Quality Inn & Suites Champaign
HotelInfo.Address: 305 Market View Dr, Champaign, IL 61821
